questions:
Consider matrix m:

m <- matrix(1:9, nrow=3, ncol=3, byrow=TRUE)
##[1,]1 2 3
##[2,]4 5 6
##[3,]7 8 9

How do you address one value in row 2, column 2?  *m[2,2]*

And another one in row 1, column 3? *m[1,3]*

questions:
Consider matrix m:

m <- matrix(1:9, nrow=3, ncol=3, byrow=TRUE)

How do you get multiple values at once in a matrix m?

How do you get the entire second row? *m[2,]*

How do you get the entire second column?  *m[,2]*

questions:
Consider matrix m:

m <- matrix(1:9, nrow=3, ncol=3, byrow=TRUE)
##[1,]1 2 3
##[2,]4 5 6
##[3,]7 8 9

How do you change values of a matrix m?

Change the value in the second column, third row to five: *m[3,2]<-5*

Change all values in the third row to 9: *m[3,]<-9*

params.textField:
You have a vector v. It contains a sequence of numbers from 1 to 10:
v <- 1:10

Get the third element of a vector v: *v[3]*
Get elements 3 and 5 of vector v: *v[3,5]*
Return all elements except the second: *v[-2]*
How do you change position 3 from 3 to 5? *v[3]<-5*
What character do you use to select non-sequential numerical values? With a *comma*
What character do you use to select sequential numerical values? With a *colon*
